name: Salt and Spice Pork Wrap
author: Phillip D. Humphrey
summary: First this recipe is very easy to make and cooks fairly fast. All it takes is a pork chop, some onion salt, cayenne pepper, a tortilla, cheese, and a touch of salsa, or guacamole.
directions: Season pork chop with onion salt, cayenne, and pepper
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat
Add the pork chop and cook until lightly browned on both sides, about 4 minutes per side
Cut pork chop into 1/4 inch strips, return to the skillet, and cook until no longer pink
Smear the center of the tortilla with salsa or guacamole; sprinkle with Cheddar cheese
Place pork strips on top of the cheese and roll tortilla up into a wrap
